page.title: 15Buckden Palace
page.content: Buckden's well known landmark is Buckden Palace which is known in the Village as the Towers. It is not certain how long a palace has stood on the site, the earliest record being 1186. The palace's most famous visitor was Catherine of Aragon who stayed there after her divorce to Henery VIII. Since 1956 The Towers has been owned by the Claretian congregation of Missionaries who have carried out much restoration. In 1956 a church was built which now serves the parish of Buckden's catholic community. It is dedicated to St. Hugh of Lincoln. The brothers hold courses for young christians and the Great Tower now contains living accomadation as well as a meeting room for young people.
